name: UpdateBreakType
description:
Update an existing BreakType configuration.

Utilize this tool to modify the settings of an existing BreakType in the Squareup labor management system. Useful for updating rules related to employee break periods.

parameters.name: break_type_uuid
parameters.description: The UUID of the BreakType to be updated.

value_schema.description: The UUID for the `BreakType` being updated.

parameters.name: business_location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the business location this type of break applies to. Required for updating break settings.

value_schema.description: The ID of the business location this type of break applies to.

parameters.name: break_name
parameters.description: A human-readable name for the break type, shown to team members in Square products.

value_schema.description:
A human-readable name for this type of break. The name is displayed to
team members in Square products.

parameters.name: break_duration_rfc3339
parameters.description: The expected duration of the break in RFC-3339 format (e.g., PT15M for 15 minutes).

value_schema.description:
Format: RFC-3339 P[n]Y[n]M[n]DT[n]H[n]M[n]S. The expected length of
this break. Precision less than minutes is truncated.

Example for break expected duration of 15 minutes: PT15M

parameters.name: break_counts_for_compensation
parameters.description: Set to true if this break counts towards time worked for compensation purposes.

value_schema.description:
Whether this break counts towards time worked for compensation
purposes.

parameters.name: break_type_id
parameters.description: The UUID for the BreakType object being updated. This is required for identifying which BreakType to modify.

parameters.name: version_for_concurrency
parameters.description: The version number for concurrency control. Helps resolve conflicts by matching the server's current version.

value_schema.description:
Used for resolving concurrency issues. The request fails if the version
provided does not match the server version at the time of the request. If a value is not
provided, Square's servers execute a "blind" write; potentially
overwriting another writer's data.

parameters.name: break_type_creation_timestamp
parameters.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format indicating when the BreakType was created. This is not modifiable.

value_schema.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format.

parameters.name: readonly_updated_at_timestamp
parameters.description: The read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format indicating the last update time for BreakType. It's not modifiable.

value_schema.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the squareup API.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The UUID for the `BreakType` being updated.

value_schema.description: The UUID for the `BreakType` being updated.

Example for break expected duration of 15 minutes: PT15M

value_schema.description:

Example for break expected duration of 15 minutes: PT15M

parameters.description:
Whether this break counts towards time worked for compensation
purposes.

purposes.

Used for resolving concurrency issues. The request fails if the version

provided, Square's servers execute a "blind" write; potentially
overwriting another writer's data.

value_schema.description:
Used for resolving concurrency issues. The request fails if the version
provided does not match the server version at the time of the request. If a value is not
provided, Square's servers execute a "blind" write; potentially
overwriting another writer's data.

parameters.name: break_type.created_at
parameters.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format.

value_schema.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format.

parameters.name: break_type.updated_at
parameters.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format.

value_schema.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format.
